comments.en:
For basic printing functionality use the HPIJS driver . For advanced functionality such as printer status and maintenance features, use the HPLIP driver (which includes HPIJS).

To get its maximum quality, use the "hpijs" driver.

Older user comments:

Colors are a little off with the dj550 driver, but prints OK otherwise. Probably does not use the full resolution. Maybe other HP drivers will work better?

According to an article on deja.com, the DeskJet 832C is technologically the same as the DeskJet 882C, only slower and with a reduced duty cycle. Whether that's true or not, it seems to print fine with the cdj880 driver in 300 or 600 dpi. However, the cdj880 driver's author's remarks (regarding quality on the DeskJet 882C printer) do apply to the DeskJet 832C printer as well.

Anyone qualified to say if this printer qualifies for "Perfect" functionality with the cdj880 driver?
